subject: RE: [junit] Asserting for the number of instances of a class: Possible?
msgSnippet: That s more of a Java question than a JUnit question.  One approach, I suppose, is have a class variable in your particular class that increments every time
messageBody:
That's more of a Java question than a JUnit question. One approach, I
suppose, is have a class variable in your "particular class" that
increments every time a new instance is created. Then, have a getter
for that class variable, and assert on that.

assertTrue("there are too few instances", (10 <
ParticularClass.instanceCount()));
assertTrue("there are too many instances", (1000 >
ParticularClass.instanceCount()));

If you don't want to change ParticularClass, then you'll need to do some
sort of magic in querying the JVM, I suppose. And I don't know how to
do that, offhand.


Todd.

> that have been created for a particular class and/or the
> number of instances that are still "around".
>

> when I can distinguish between "few" (<10) and "many" (>1000).

> Is this possible with JUnit somehow?
